vocabulary.definition: in a way that is full of danger or risk
vocabulary.example: The hikers were walking perilously close to the edge of the cliff.

vocabulary.definition: extreme patriotism, often favoring an aggressive, warlike foreign policy
vocabulary.example: His speeches were filled with jingoism, advocating for military action against other countries.

vocabulary.definition: not having reached full potential or growth
vocabulary.example: The project remained undeveloped due to lack of funding.

vocabulary.definition: sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings or misfortunes of others
vocabulary.example: His compassion towards the homeless drove him to volunteer at a shelter.

vocabulary.definition: modeled on or aiming for a state in which everything is perfect; idealistic
vocabulary.example: The novel depicted a utopian society where there was no poverty or crime.
Listening to music assuages her anxiety before exams.
